channel.title: Genuine myspace codes. w/ tutorials (finished)
channel.description:
Genuine myspace codes & tutorials, these are more reliable than the shit you find on other sites so use what you can, and please keep this clean.
[center] [b][size=15pt]Contents[/size] [ul][li]Myspace: Changing the color of table name colors, and section name colors.[/li][li]Myspace: How to create your own hide codes that work tutorial.[/li] [li]Myspace: how to change size, color, and font for specific sections.[/li] [li]Myspace change table color tutorial[/li] [li]Genuine myspace codes[/li][/ul] [/center] [u] [b]Myspace change table name colors, and section name colors[/b][/u]
1. Okay, to start figure out how to access your myspace page, the one your URL leads to.
2. Left click on your page and go to your page source.
3. Heres where things get a little harder, we are going to find your table class ID. You are going to have to navigate yourself through your page source. To find your page source left click on your page and select "View Page Source" or hit CTRL+U (firefox). Now that we are in your page source, you are going to have to search something that is most likely going to be in that class. example: In your page source, search your profile name, your class ID will be right next to it heres what your Class ID should look like for your profile. [code]<span class="nametext">[/code]
4. Okay now that we should have your class ID this is what we are going to do with it we are going to use the following base code, [code]<style> .[b]yourclassID[/b] { color:[b]Hex color. ie 00000[/b]; } </style>[/code] Insert your class ID into where it says 'yourclassID" and then put a color into were you see the "Hex Color". Important: You must have a period infront of your class ID or it won't work, and for multiple class ID's into one code insert a comma inbetween each class ID. and you must put a ";" after your color code.
5. Put this code into any section and save, it should work if not you did it wrong.
[b][u]Myspace: How to create your own hide codes that work tutorial.[/u][/b]
1. Okay, to start figure out how to access your myspace page, the one your URL leads to.
2. Left click on your page and go to your page source.
3. Heres where things get a little harder, we are going to find your table class ID. You are going to have to navigate yourself through your page source. To find your page source left click on your page and select "View Page Source" or hit CTRL+U (firefox). Now that we are in your page source, you are going to have to search something that is most likely going to be in that class. example: In your page source, search your profile name, your class ID will be right next to it heres what your Class ID should look like for your profile. [code]<span class="nametext">[/code]
4. Here is the base code we will be using. [code]<style> .[b]Class ID[/b] {visibility:[b]variable[/b];} </style>[/code]
5. Insert your class ID that we found. and for your variable, here is what you can do. "visible" will make it visible (noshit?), "hidden" not shown but a space is still there where your table was, "collapse" makes it that it is hidden and there is no space. and you must put a ";" after your variable.
6. Copy your code into any section and then save, this should work with everything besides comments.
[b][u]Myspace: how to change size, color, and font for specific sections.[/u][/b]
1. this is our base code: [code]<font family="Verdana" size="1" color="black">
your text
[/code]
2. refer to this website for fonts [url=http://www.angelfire.com/fl5/html-tutorial/fontlist.htm]http://www.angelfire.com/fl5/html-tutorial/fontlist.htm [/url] 3. size can be changed to whatever, and the color can be what ever. 4. put in your text. 5. and as always put the code into any section and save.
[b][u]Myspace change table color tutorial[/u][/b]
1. First of by table color, i mean the background of the table name so this is how we will do it.
2. Okay, to start figure out how to access your myspace page, the one your URL leads to.
3. Left click on your page and go to your page source.
4. Heres where things get a little harder, we are going to find your table class ID. You are going to have to navigate yourself through your page source. To find your page source left click on your page and select "View Page Source" or hit CTRL+U (firefox). Now that we are in your page source, you are going to have to search something that is most likely going to be in that class. example: In your page source, search your profile name, your class ID will be right next to it heres what your Class ID should look like for your profile. [code]<span class="nametext">[/code]
5. this is our base code: [code]<style> .[b]classID[/b] { background-color:[b]color ID[/b]; } </style>[/code]
6. Change the code to suite your needs, put it into a section and save.
[b][u]Genuine myspace codes[/u][/b] I am just going to put the codes i have into a code box for your use, these all work.
[b]all links, i think...[/b] [code]<style type="text/css"> a:link{color:black;} a:visited{color:black;} a:active{color:black;} a.navbar{color:black;} a.navbar:link{color:black;} a.navbar:active{color:black;} a.navbar:visited{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:link{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:active{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:visited{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:hover{color:black;} .redbtext { color:black; } </style>[/code]
[b]Hide friends (edit the height to your needs.[/b] [code]<div style="position:relative; height:710px; overflow:hidden; border:0px;"><table><tr><td><table><tr><td> [/code]
[b]all orange text (edit to your needs)[/b] [code]<style> .orangetext15 { color:000000; } </style>[/code]
[b]Removes your URL completely[/b] [code]<style> .userProfileURL {visibility:collapse;} </style>[/code]
[b]I believe this to be the code to change all orange bar colors. (edit to your needs)[/b] [code]<style> td.text table {width:100%;} .blurbs, .blurbs td.text { background-color:6699cc; } </style>[/code]
[b]This may be the Interest/About me color codes.[/b] [code]<style> .text tdborder { color:000000; } </style> [/code]
[b]I think this is the code for all white text.[/b] [code]<style> .whitetext12 { color:000000 } </style>[/code]
[b]I forget this might be the code to change the color of dates in comments.[/b] [code]<style> .lightbluetext8 { color:000000 } </style>[/code]
[b]Some kind of border...[/b] [code]<style> td.text table {width:100%;} .friendsComments td table, .friendsComments td.text table { background-color:ffffff; } </style>[/code]
[b]Another some kind of border...[/b] [code]<style> td.text table {width:100%;} .friendSpace table { background-color:ffffff; } </style [/code]
[b]Hide code for something..[/b] [code]<style type="text/css">a.text, table div font a, table div div {visibility:hidden;}</style> [/code]
[b]Background image code[/b] [code]<style type="text/css"> table, tr, td { background-color:visible; border:1px; border-width:0;} body { background-image:url('IMAGE URL.'); background-attachment:fixed; background-repeat:repeat; } }</style> [/code]
Well, this is my tutorial and code thread, all codes by me and tutorials by me. I learned these the same way i'm teaching, giving examples and editing.

item.title: Genuine myspace codes. w/ tutorials (finished)
item.dc:creator: @Cryme_Time Cryme Time
item.description:
@Cryme_Time wrote:

Genuine myspace codes & tutorials, these are more reliable than the shit you find on other sites so use what you can, and please keep this clean.

[center]
[b][size=15pt]Contents[/size]
[ul][li]Myspace: Changing the color of table name colors, and section name colors.[/li][li]Myspace: How to create your own hide codes that work tutorial.[/li]
[li]Myspace: how to change size, color, and font for specific sections.[/li]
[li]Myspace change table color tutorial[/li]
[li]Genuine myspace codes[/li][/ul]
[/center]

Myspace change table name colors, and section name colors

  1. Okay, to start figure out how to access your myspace page, the one your URL leads to.

  2. Left click on your page and go to your page source.

  3. Heres where things get a little harder, we are going to find your table class ID. You are going to have to navigate yourself through your page source. To find your page source left click on your page and select “View Page Source” or hit CTRL+U (firefox). Now that we are in your page source, you are going to have to search something that is most likely going to be in that class. example: In your page source, search your profile name, your class ID will be right next to it heres what your Class ID should look like for your profile.

<span class="nametext">
  1. Okay now that we should have your class ID this is what we are going to do with it we are going to use the following base code,

<style> .[b]yourclassID[/b] { color:[b]Hex color. ie 00000[/b]; } </style>
Insert your class ID into where it says 'yourclassID" and then put a color into were you see the “Hex Color”. Important: You must have a period infront of your class ID or it won’t work, and for multiple class ID’s into one code insert a comma inbetween each class ID. and you must put a “;” after your color code.

  1. Put this code into any section and save, it should work if not you did it wrong.

Myspace: How to create your own hide codes that work tutorial.

  1. Okay, to start figure out how to access your myspace page, the one your URL leads to.

  2. Left click on your page and go to your page source.

  3. Heres where things get a little harder, we are going to find your table class ID. You are going to have to navigate yourself through your page source. To find your page source left click on your page and select “View Page Source” or hit CTRL+U (firefox). Now that we are in your page source, you are going to have to search something that is most likely going to be in that class. example: In your page source, search your profile name, your class ID will be right next to it heres what your Class ID should look like for your profile.

<span class="nametext">
  1. Here is the base code we will be using.

<style> .[b]Class ID[/b] {visibility:[b]variable[/b];} </style>

  1. Insert your class ID that we found. and for your variable, here is what you can do. “visible” will make it visible (noshit?), “hidden” not shown but a space is still there where your table was, “collapse” makes it that it is hidden and there is no space. and you must put a “;” after your variable.

  2. Copy your code into any section and then save, this should work with everything besides comments.

Myspace: how to change size, color, and font for specific sections.

  1. this is our base code:

[code]

your text

[/code]

  1. refer to this website for fonts http://www.angelfire.com/fl5/html-tutorial/fontlist.htm
  2. size can be changed to whatever, and the color can be what ever.
  3. put in your text.
  4. and as always put the code into any section and save.

Myspace change table color tutorial

  1. First of by table color, i mean the background of the table name so this is how we will do it.

  2. Okay, to start figure out how to access your myspace page, the one your URL leads to.

  3. Left click on your page and go to your page source.

  4. Heres where things get a little harder, we are going to find your table class ID. You are going to have to navigate yourself through your page source. To find your page source left click on your page and select “View Page Source” or hit CTRL+U (firefox). Now that we are in your page source, you are going to have to search something that is most likely going to be in that class. example: In your page source, search your profile name, your class ID will be right next to it heres what your Class ID should look like for your profile.

<span class="nametext">
  1. this is our base code:

<style> .[b]classID[/b] { background-color:[b]color ID[/b]; } </style>

  1. Change the code to suite your needs, put it into a section and save.

Genuine myspace codes
I am just going to put the codes i have into a code box for your use, these all work.

all links, i think…

<style type="text/css"> a:link{color:black;} a:visited{color:black;} a:active{color:black;} a.navbar{color:black;} a.navbar:link{color:black;} a.navbar:active{color:black;} a.navbar:visited{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:link{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:active{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:visited{color:black;} a.searchlinksmall:hover{color:black;} .redbtext { color:black; } </style>

Hide friends (edit the height to your needs.

<div style="position:relative; height:710px; overflow:hidden; border:0px;"><table><tr><td><table><tr><td>

all orange text (edit to your needs)

<style> .orangetext15 { color:000000; } </style>

Removes your URL completely

<style> .userProfileURL {visibility:collapse;} </style>

I believe this to be the code to change all orange bar colors. (edit to your needs)

<style> td.text table {width:100%;} .blurbs, .blurbs td.text { background-color:6699cc; } </style>

This may be the Interest/About me color codes.

<style> .text tdborder { color:000000; } </style>

I think this is the code for all white text.

<style> .whitetext12 { color:000000 } </style>

I forget this might be the code to change the color of dates in comments.

<style> .lightbluetext8 { color:000000 } </style>

Some kind of border…

<style> td.text table {width:100%;} .friendsComments td table, .friendsComments td.text table { background-color:ffffff; } </style>

Another some kind of border…

<style> td.text table {width:100%;} .friendSpace table { background-color:ffffff; } </style

Hide code for something…

<style type="text/css">a.text, table div font a, table div div {visibility:hidden;}</style>

Background image code

<style type="text/css"> table, tr, td { background-color:visible; border:1px; border-width:0;} body { background-image:url('IMAGE URL.'); background-attachment:fixed; background-repeat:repeat; } }</style>

Well, this is my tutorial and code thread, all codes by me and tutorials by me. I learned these the same way i’m teaching, giving examples and editing.

Read full topic
